tool.name: SAGA.shapes_tools.23
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False isArrayFIELD_Z False isArrayFIELD_M False output_data_OUTPUT $output_data_OUTPUT name SAGA.shapes_tools.23 INPUT $INPUT FIELD_Z $FIELD_Z FIELD_M $FIELD_M prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.outputType_OUTPUT transmissionMode_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.transmissionMode_OUTPUT

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Input
param.help: The shapefile to convert. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: FIELD_Z
param.label: Z
param.help: Field with z-coordinate information. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_M
param.label: M
param.help: Field with measure information. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTPUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_OUTPUT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: The tool allows one to convert the vertex type of shapes from 'XY' (2D) to 'XYZ/M' (3D) and vice versa. The conversion from 3D to 2D is not lossless for lines and polygons, as only the Z/M value of one vertex can be retained (currently that of the last vertex).
